CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 15, 1953, pg. 6 reads: "Teen-Agers Hold Final Party - The St. Brigid's Teen-ager Club held a final party, which closed its summer activities, in St. Brigid School Hall, 1833 Wylie Avenue, Tuesday night. It was an affair which was thoroughly enjoyed by the club members who will not meet again until September.  The club met every Tuesday evening in the school hall during the summer.  Sister M. Cyril, directress of the House of Mary, 1614 Webster Avenue, is founder of the club, which has done an excellent job in combating juvenile delinquency.  Sister M .Eva is assistant to Sister Cyril, Harold Wallace is president of the club; John Dilingham, secretary, and Doris Simms, treasurer. Father Paul Bassompierre is administrator of St. Brigid Church and also director of St. Joseph House of Hospitality and the St. Vincent de Paul Society. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group of young men and young women of the St. Brigid's Teen-ager Club, seated at banquet tables, with Sister M. Cyril, Sister M. Eva, and Father Paul Bassompierre, standing in background, during party in St. Brigid School Hall, 1833 Wylie Avenue, Hill District, another version
